Fort_Wayne.Rialto Theatre (Fort Wayne, Indiana):
The Rialto Theatre, 2616 S. Calhoun Street, Fort Wayne, Indiana, opened in 1924 as a 700-seat Streamline Moderne style theater. In the 1940s, a balcony was added. It closed in 1989 and in 1993 was named by the city as a "locally designated historic district."
Built for $150,000, it "was considered one of the Midwest's most beautiful theaters."
A non-profit organization, The Reclamation Project, bought the Rialto in 2003 with the intention of rehabbing it at an estimated cost of $2 million.
